item.title: SolvedMinNoCoins
item.description: I eventually solved this Kata and it’s the first one I have come across which I didn’t enjoy doing. I found the challenge to lack any consistency in what inputs were considered valid or invalid, and in the end it became a case of simply filtering out the edge cases through if-statements. It seemed entirely capricious as to why it wouldn’t accept .5 but would accept .16, £1p was valid but £.

item.title: Kata: Minimum Number of Coins
item.description: This evening I decided to have a go at the kata “Minimum Number of Coins”. The first challenge in this kata is to validate the number given which can be quite varied. The amount may be either a number or a string. If it is a string, it may or may not be prefixed with “£” or suffixed with “p”. If it is a number, it can be either an integer or a float.

item.title: Welcome
item.description: Last night I followed this tutorial to build this blog that runs off a github repo. I thought this would be a better way to keep a track of my progress as a coder than merely keeping a repo filled with commented .js files, which I was doing here. I thought about moving everything over and formatting each item as a blog post, but I don’t think that’s really necessary. This blog will be used for updates and thoughts on problems I am working on and things that I am learning.
